headline.print_headline: US Defender Goodson Seeks Great Role at World Cup
headline.main: US Defender Goodson Seeks Great Role at World Cup

docs.snippet: Clarence Goodson led the U.S. soccer team onto the Stanford Stadium field for Day 1 of World Cup training, about 20 paces ahead of teammates....
docs.lead_paragraph: Clarence Goodson led the U.S. soccer team onto the Stanford Stadium field for Day 1 of World Cup training, about 20 paces ahead of teammates.

headline.print_headline: TSA Opens Pre-enrollment Site at Charlotte Douglas
headline.main: TSA Opens Pre-enrollment Site at Charlotte Douglas

docs.snippet: The Transportation Security Administration has opened an enrollment office at Charlotte Douglas International Airport where passengers can apply to move through expedited security lanes....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Transportation Security Administration has opened an enrollment office at Charlotte Douglas International Airport where passengers can apply to move through expedited security lanes.

headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania Teen Charged With Sending Poison Card to Love Rival
headline.main: Pennsylvania Teen Charged With Sending Poison Card to Love Rival

docs.snippet: A suburban Philadelphia teen charged with attempted murder in connection with a ricin-laced birthday card sent to try to scare off a romantic rival is headed to trial....
docs.lead_paragraph: A suburban Philadelphia teen charged with attempted murder in connection with a ricin-laced birthday card sent to try to scare off a romantic rival is headed to trial.

docs.snippet: President Obama, former President Bill Clinton and two former mayors, Michael R. Bloomberg and Rudolph W. Giuliani, attended the ceremony at the National September 11 Memorial Museum....

headline.main: Paul Taylor Sells Four Rauschenbergs at Sotheby's

docs.snippet: The choreographer Paul Taylor sold four of his Robert Rauschenberg pieces on Wednesday and Thursday to help pay for the new center of modern dance he is creating....
docs.abstract: The choreographer Paul Taylor sold four of his Robert Rauschenberg pieces on Wednesday and Thursday to help pay for the new center of modern dance he is creating.

headline.print_headline: Bill Limits Full Contact Youth Football Drills
headline.main: Bill Limits Full Contact Youth Football Drills

docs.snippet: Responding to parental safety concerns, the state Assembly on Thursday passed legislation limiting full-contact practices for high school football teams....
docs.lead_paragraph: Responding to parental safety concerns, the state Assembly on Thursday passed legislation limiting full-contact practices for high school football teams.

headline.print_headline: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Did Thursday
headline.main: How the Dow Jones Industrial Average Did Thursday

docs.snippet: Investors retreated from stocks Thursday, leading the Dow Jones industrial average to its worst day in five weeks, after disappointing earnings from Wal-Mart and mixed news about the global economy....
docs.lead_paragraph: Investors retreated from stocks Thursday, leading the Dow Jones industrial average to its worst day in five weeks, after disappointing earnings from Wal-Mart and mixed news about the global economy.

headline.main: Rackspace Hires Morgan Stanley to Explore Options

docs.snippet: Rackspace, a web-hosting company with a market value of more than $4 billion, has hired Morgan Stanley to evaluate a sale or other strategic options, after being approached by potential suitors....
docs.abstract: Rackspace, a web-hosting company with a market value of more than $4 billion, has hired Morgan Stanley to evaluate a sale or other strategic options, after being approached by potential suitors.

headline.print_headline: A Look at Key Moments for Aaron Hernandez
headline.main: A Look at Key Moments for Aaron Hernandez

docs.snippet: — June 8, 2010. Aaron Hernandez, a standout tight end drafted from the University of Florida, signs a four-year contract with the New England Patriots....
docs.lead_paragraph: — June 8, 2010. Aaron Hernandez, a standout tight end drafted from the University of Florida, signs a four-year contract with the New England Patriots.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Allows Limited Exceptions to Ivory Ban for Instruments, Art
headline.main: U.S. Allows Limited Exceptions to Ivory Ban for Instruments, Art

docs.snippet: The U.S. government on Thursday took steps to allow limited exceptions to its broad prohibition on the commercial trade in elephant ivory, exempting certain older musical instruments with ivory components as well as ivory in museum and art exhibit...
docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. government on Thursday took steps to allow limited exceptions to its broad prohibition on the commercial trade in elephant ivory, exempting certain older musical instruments with ivory components as well as ivory in museum and art exhibitions.
